title: Szczecin
summary: Szczecin[lower-alpha 1] (Polish: [ˈʂt͡ʂɛt͡ɕin] (listen), German: Stettin [ʃtɛˈtiːn] (listen)) is the capital and largest city of the West Pomeranian Voivodeship in northwestern Poland. Located near the Baltic Sea and the German border, it is a major seaport and Poland's seventh-largest city. As of December 2020, the population was 398,255.[1]
